  • Constructor Details

    • JGit

      public JGit​(String localPath) throws IOException, IllegalStateException, org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException
      Initialization of a new repository
      Parameters:
      localPath - new repository path
      Throws:
      IOException - if the repository cannot be created
      IllegalStateException - if something wrong
      org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException - if there is a error in the git configuration.

    • JGit

      public JGit​(String localRepoDir, String username, String password) throws IOException
      Creates instance of PiGit with a local repository
      Parameters:
      username - user name
      password - password
      localRepoDir - the local directory path
      Throws:
      IOException - if something wrong.

    • JGit

      public JGit​(String localPath, String user, String pwd, String host, String pathToRemoteRepo) throws IOException, org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException
      Creates a new instance of PiGit according to a remote repository
      Parameters:
      localPath - local path to clone the repository
      user - user name
      pwd - password
      host - host where the repository has to be clone
      pathToRemoteRepo - remote path of the repo on the server side
      Throws:
      IOException - if the repo cannot be write
      org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException - if the repo cannot be clonned.

    • JGit

      public JGit​(String localRepoName, String username, String password, String url) throws org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.InvalidRemoteException, org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.TransportException, org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException
      Throws:
      org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.InvalidRemoteException

      org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException

    • JGit

      public JGit​(String localRepoName, String url) throws org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.InvalidRemoteException, org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.TransportException, org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException
      Clone a git repository without credential
      Parameters:
      localRepoName - local name of the repository
      url - url of the remote repository to clone
      Throws:
      org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.InvalidRemoteException - if the remote url is wrong
      org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.TransportException - if something wrong during the download
      org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException - if simething wrong in the git comment ( e.g. git not installed)

    • commitAfile

      public void commitAfile​(String inputPathFile, String message) throws IOException, org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.NoFilepatternException, org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException
      Commit change of a file to the git repository.
      Parameters:
      inputPathFile - path of the file to commit change or add the file ( including sub hierarchy as src/package/filname.txt")
      message - commit message
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be copy in the repository
      org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.NoFilepatternException - if the file is corrupted
      org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException - if something is wrong on the git configuration

    • AddFile2Git

      public static void AddFile2Git​(String localRepoName, String dirInRepo, File file2add, String usr, String pwd, String uri)
      Add, commit and push a new file to a git repository
      Parameters:
      localRepoName - local name of the git repository (Example: schema-storage)
      dirInRepo - directory inside the repo where the file has to be added. (Example to have "repo/directory/subdirectory/file.xml":dirInRepo= "directory/subdirectory/)"
      file2add - file to add ( will be copied)
      usr - user name for the authentication in the git
      pwd - password of the user for the authentication
      uri - URI of the git repository (Example: https://git.gdi-de.org/claire.prudhomme/schema-storage.git)

      public static void main​(String[] args)
